contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Victor Ruffy.gif|thumb|right|Victor Ruffy]] '''Victor Ruffy''' (18 January 1823 - 29 December 1869) was a [[Switzerland|Swiss]] politician. He was elected to the [[Federal Council of Switzerland]] on 6 December 1867, and died in office on 29 December 1869. He was affiliated with the [[Free Democratic Party of Switzerland]]. During his time in office he held the following departments: *[[Department of Finance (Switzerland)|Department of Finance]] (1868) *[[Military Department (Switzerland)|Military Department]] (1869) His son [[Eugène Ruffy]] (1854–1919) was member of the Federal Council from 1893 to 1899. ==External links== *{{Swiss Federal Councillor|17}} {{s-start}} {{succession box | before = [[Joachim Heer]] | title =[[President of the Swiss National Council|President of the National Council]]| years = 1863/1864 | after = [[Gottlieb Jäger]]}} {{succession box | before = [[Constant Fornerod]] | title = [[Member of the Swiss Federal Council]] | years = 1867–1869 | after = [[Paul Cérésole]]}} {{s-end}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Ruffy, Victor | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Swiss politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 18 January 1823 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 29 December 1869 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ruffy, Victor}} [[Category:1823 births]] [[Category:1869 deaths]] [[Category:People from Lavaux-Oron District]] [[Category:Members of the Swiss Federal Council]] [[Category:Free Democratic Party of Switzerland politicians]] [[Category:Federal Supreme Court of Switzerland judges]] {{Switzerland-politician-stub}}
